name: Epistemology
synopsis: How do we know what we know? Evaluate evidence, doubt well, and separate belief from truth.

name: Logic & Critical Thinking
synopsis: Spot weak arguments, hidden assumptions, and faulty reasoning — including your own.

name: Mind & Self
synopsis: Understand how emotions, habits, and biases shape your decisions and beliefs.

name: Literature & Wisdom
synopsis: Use stories and timeless ideas to recognize patterns in human thinking and behavior.

name: Philosophy of History
synopsis: Learn how narratives shape the past — and why different people interpret history differently.

name: Worldview & Cultures
synopsis: See how different cultures frame reality — and why intelligent people disagree.

name: Applied Ethics
synopsis: Reason through moral dilemmas with tradeoffs, consequences, and principles — not preaching.

name: Modern Questions
synopsis: Think clearly about today’s issues without being told what to believe.

name: Pop Culture & Media Literacy
synopsis: Decode persuasion, algorithms, and narratives shaping attention and belief.

name: Street Lessons
synopsis: Practical wisdom: incentives, power, human behavior, and real-world decision-making.

name: Creative Thinking
synopsis: Generate new ideas, reframe problems, and break mental ruts.

name: Work & Hustle
synopsis: Think clearly about risk, tradeoffs, and success — avoiding hustle myths.
